oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Handkerchief given to WWI soldier Virgil T. Metcalf by female friend
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This handkerchief, decorated in the corners with printed swallows and flowers, was given to Virgil Metcalf by a female friend. It is retained in an envelope addressed to Mr. Virgil Metcalf, Maryville with "A Farewell Gift" on the reverse. Virgil was inducted in McMinn County in May 1918 and was a salesman at the time. He was in 47th Engineers and but transferred to 56 Trans. Co. in Sept. He was discharged as July 14, 1919. In 1931-32, he spent several months in Mountain Home Branch for tonsilitis
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
